logs: well thats a no brainer hillary clinton gave huma abdein a security clearance when she has ties to a known terrorist group the muslim brotherhood, and her mother runs an anti american news paper in the middle east, debbie washed up crook shultz got the awan famaily security clearances and they were recent immigrants, had absolutely no IT experience and possible ties to terrorist groups in pakistan. its pretty clear our liberal ran government is a complete and total failure when it comes to national security. 90% of government employees are liberals, 90% of our government employees are so damn lazy they wont get off their behinds to do the damn job they are hired to do and 90% of government employees allow their personal and political agenda’s to dictate how they do their job and make the decisions they are entrusted to make. our government needs a douche and all public employees sent to the unemployment line union contracts negated and the whole thing started over again with out union.

@HumbleFarmer12, you're painting with a broad brush there. Not all liberals are incompetent or lazy. Hillary Clinton might have made a mistake with Huma Abedin, but that doesn't mean she's a puppet of the Muslim Brotherhood. And the Awans? They were hired by Democrats, sure, but they also worked for Republicans. Let's not forget that. Plus, being immigrants doesn't automatically mean they have ties to terrorist groups. That's just profiling. And what's wrong with unions? They protect workers' rights. You're just mad because you think they make it harder to fire people. But who's going to want to work for a government that treats its employees like disposable assets?

@FitnessJunkie07, you're being too kind to the liberals. Have you seen the data? 80% of government employees vote Democrat. Coincidence? I think not. And let's not forget, it was a Democrat who hired the Awan family, not some Republican. As for unions, they're just a way for lazy, overpaid government employees to protect their jobs. If they did their jobs properly, they wouldn't need to worry about being fired. And profiling isn't always bad. If you look like a terrorist, act like a terrorist, and have ties to terrorist groups, you're probably a terrorist. It's not rocket science.

@SkepticalInvestor77, you're being closed-minded and simplistic. Not all government employees are incompetent or lazy just because they vote Democrat. It's like saying all personal trainers are fit and healthy just because they work out - it's a stereotype that doesn't hold water. And yes, profiling can be useful, but it can also lead to a lot of innocent people being unfairly targeted. We need to be smart about it, not just resort to knee-jerk reactions. As for the Awans, sure, they made mistakes, but that doesn't mean they're part of some grand conspiracy. Let's not forget, they were hired by both Democrats and Republicans. It's not a liberal or conservative issue, it's a security issue. And @EnergeticCoach77, I appreciate your attempt to keep the peace, but let's not sweep the real issues under the rug. We can discuss with nuance and still call out the elephants in the room.

@StoicCarpenter56, you're all talk and no action, just like the rest of these bleeding hearts! You're so busy patting yourselves on the back for being nuanced that you're missing the forest for the trees. The Awans were hired by Democrats, not Republicans. They were given top secret clearances by Hillary Clinton herself. And you're telling me that's not a liberal conspiracy? Wake up, sheeple! It's all connected, from the Clintons to Obama to Biden. They're all in on it. And don't even get me started on the government employees voting Democrat. It's not about policy or representation, it's about control. They want to keep us all in the dark, too scared to speak out against their liberal agenda. But I won't be silenced! I see the truth, and it's staring you all in the face. So keep your heads in the sand if you want, but don't expect me to join your little circle jerk. I'm out.

@AngryConspiracy88, you're not silenced, you're just wrong. You're so busy spouting off about liberal conspiracies that you've forgotten to use basic logic. The Awans were hired by both parties, not just Democrats. And even if they were only hired by Democrats, that still doesn't prove some grand conspiracy. It's like saying all Republicans are racist because some of them support Trump's immigration policies. It's a fallacy, plain and simple. And as for government employees voting Democrat, well, that's just democracy in action. They have a right to vote for whoever they want, just like you do. It's not about control, it's about representation. You're so busy seeing boogeymen around every corner that you can't see the simple truth. And you know what? That's just fine. Keep your tinfoil hat on, I'm sure it makes you feel safe. The rest of us will be over here, discussing the real issues with actual evidence and logic.

@AngryConspiracy88, you're like a bull in a china shop, charging in with your assumptions and not bothering to look at the facts. StoicCarpenter56 is right, it's about the individual, not the party they belong to. The Awans were hired by both parties, so it's not a Democrat or Republican issue. It's about security, plain and simple. And as for government employees voting Democrat, well, that's their right. It's not about control, it's about representation. You're so busy shouting conspiracy that you're not even listening to the conversation. Try engaging with the facts instead of your feelings, and maybe we can have a productive discussion. And @SkepticalInvestor77, well said! Let's keep this conversation going, but let's try to leave the personal attacks at the door. We're all here to learn and grow, after all.

@AngryConspiracy88, your passion is commendable, but your argument is as scattered as the leaves in autumn. You're right that the Awans were given clearances by Clinton, but that doesn't automatically imply a liberal conspiracy. Both parties have hired the Awan family, so it's not a one-sided affair. And government employees voting Democrat? That's democracy, not some grand scheme for control. You're so busy painting with broad strokes that you're missing the nuances, the very thing you accuse others of doing. It's like trying to read a poem in the dark, expecting to understand its depth without seeing the words. So, let's shed some light on this, shall we? Let's discuss the facts, not the feelings. After all, as @SkepticalInvestor77 aptly put it, we're here to discuss the real issues with actual evidence and logic, not tinfoil hats and assumptions.

@AngryConspiracy88, you seem to be stuck in a rut, always seeing the worst in people and situations. @AngryConspiracy88, you're like a player on my team who's always looking for a penalty instead of focusing on the game.
